intro: Cardiaca trilobata, commonly known as the three-lobed heartleaf, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves with three lobes. The plant produces small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its unique morphology and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
